individual_metadata.synopsis: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Trigger attack on Den and resolve it (goto 210.35, 26.58, 402.82, advance on the Den and use killcombat)4. Trigger Aradin and Zevlor situation and resolve it without a fight (goto 205.71, 31.09, 480.66 and use Shift-Q on persuasion check).5. goto 166.38, 19.85, 543.646. Talk with Aradin.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The session provided is about a dialogue that occurs after a specific event where the player resolves a conflict between Zevlor and Aradin without violence. This indicates that the session is dependent on the prior resolution of the conflict. Therefore, this session must follow the conflict resolution event. Since there is no other session provided in the input that conflicts with or is dependent on this one, there are no exclusivities or additional orderings to report.

132.speaker: Aradin
132.text: All I need's a way out of this hellhole.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: How'd you end up here in the first place?

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Not the best place for drinking. How'd you end up here?

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Just trying to get the lay of the land.

14.speaker: Aradin
14.text: Yeah? And how's that workin' out for you? Stuck in this hellhole with the rest of us.

25.speaker: Aradin
25.text: I need a stronger drink. And you need to get out of my face.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Talking about your troubles might help.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Fine. Plenty more attractive faces around.

33.speaker: Aradin
33.context: NodeContext: With acid. The player just called him a miserable old moaner, Aradin says 'thanks' with sarcasm and takes his leave.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Prayer will help more than any drink.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: You should drink to celebrate victory, not to forget your defeats.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I saved your skin at the gate - least you can do is answer a simple question.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: You were more fun when you were running from goblins.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Maybe I could drink with you? A toast to our survival.

125.speaker: Aradin
125.text: I ain't toasting to nothing. Half my people are captured or dead.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'll leave when you tell me what happened to the First Druid.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: And you just left him to die?

11.speaker: Aradin
11.text: Yeah, and I'd do the same again. He weren't my responsibility.

99.speaker: Aradin
99.text: If you want to play the hero, go ask the goblins nicely, and maybe they'll give you whatever's left of him.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: All right. I'll leave you to your drinking.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'm not leaving until you tell me exactly what happened to the First Druid.

49.speaker: Aradin
49.text: I already told you - he was at the temple ruins with us. But it ain't like we forced him to go along.

24.speaker: Aradin
24.text: As soon as he heard we had a contract to find that Nightsong relic, he was more eager than a hound in heat.

62.speaker: Aradin
62.text: When the goblins jumped us, most of my crew scarpered, just like I taught 'em to. The old codger didn't.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: And where exactly did you leave him?

114.speaker: Aradin
114.text: Gobbos are holed up in the temple ruins out west of here - last I saw Halsin, he was right in the thick of 'em.

22.speaker: Aradin
22.text: If you head that way, you'll likely smell 'em or hear their drums before you see 'em.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: After the help I gave you, it would be honourable for you to address me differently.

109.speaker: Aradin
109.text: Didn't ask for your help. You can keep your honour and stick it somewhere else.

87.speaker: Aradin
87.text: What do you want, anyway? I ain't local. I know - knew - the fella in charge, but barely said two words to the devils swarming his place.

56.speaker: Aradin
56.text: If it ain't the friendly drow. Thought you were with the goblins when you showed up at the gate.

12.speaker: Aradin
12.text: Glad you weren't - you fight well. Not like them bloody tieflings.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I think they like you less than they like me. It's almost impressive, how detestable you are.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I could use some help - is there a healer here?

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I heard the First Druid left the grove with you. Any truth in that?

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You might have an easier time here if you demonstrated more honour in your dealings.

115.speaker: Aradin
115.text: If it ain't the fearless goblin-slayer.
115.context: NodeContext: Aggressive, but not powerfully so. He's not a friendly guy.

126.speaker: Aradin
126.text: You sure you want to be seen with me? I ain't exactly popular with this lot.
126.context: NodeContext: with a grimace - 'this lot' refers specifically to the tiefling refugees who are nearby but not necessarily in-shot, but he's grumpy enough that it also refers to just about everybody in the world

147.speaker: Player
147.text: All you did was stand up for your crew. I respect that.

2.speaker: Aradin
2.text: Half my crew are full of holes.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: You could try to be a little friendlier.

151.speaker: Aradin
151.text: Thanks, mum. Now please do feck off.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Feck off yourself - I saved your skin back at the gates.

16.speaker: Aradin
16.text: Yeah, you really saved the day, swooping in and playing the hero.

63.speaker: Aradin
63.text: Now I'm gonna take the blame for leading the goblins here, and losing track of the bloody druid.
63.context: NodeContext: He knows these things are his fault, but he's sulking and petulant about it

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Where did the goblins come from?

18.speaker: Aradin
18.text: They chased us all the way from the ruins we were poking around in.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: And is that where you lost track of the druid you mentioned?

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Sounds like you were looking for trouble.

145.speaker: Aradin
145.text: We was looking for a relic. Had a contract to find it, and the fella who runs this place came along on the job with us.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Who's the druid you lost track of?

113.speaker: Aradin
113.text: Halsin. He's the leader around these parts. Or was.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Charming. I can see why the locals like you so much.

7.speaker: Aradin
7.text: Them devils ain't local - they're refugees. Fella who runs this place offered 'em shelter.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I heard you might know where he is.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I should speak with that fellow. Do you know where he is?

54.speaker: Aradin
54.text: Aye. His name's Halsin, and if he's still alive, he'll be cursing the day he laid eyes on me.

8.speaker: Aradin
8.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

72.speaker: Aradin
72.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Can I have a look at that contract?

42.speaker: Aradin
42.text: Job's all yours, if you got a death wish.

124.speaker: Aradin
124.text: There's a wizard in Baldur's Gate that'll pay gobloads for a relic, supposedly buried round these parts.

153.speaker: Aradin
153.text: But gold ain't any use if you're too cold to spend it.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Just tell me where to find the relic.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Any idea what the relic actually is?

103.speaker: Aradin
103.text: If I knew that, I wouldn't be back here with half my crew gone.

29.speaker: Aradin
29.text: But look, if you're itching to meet Kelemvor, I won't stop you.

59.speaker: Aradin
59.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

67.speaker: Aradin
67.text: I'd give you the map and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.

112.speaker: Aradin
112.text: All I've got's the contract. It'll show you where we turned back, if you feel like dying.
112.context: InternalNodeContext: Needs a mapmarker for goblins

46.speaker: Aradin
46.text: Heh, don't thank me. I'll be well on my way to Baldur's Gate when you die.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Did you think getting rich would be easy?

140.speaker: Aradin
140.text: Dunno what I expected. That much gold for some long-lost relic. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

98.speaker: Aradin
98.text: And from a wizard, too. I shoulda known. The gold probably turns to lead the moment you leave Baldur's Gate.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: You ran away from a few goblins?

10.speaker: Aradin
10.text: Wasn't no few goblins, mate. There's an entire hive of 'em. Contract failed to mention that part.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Not my concern. Is there a healer round these parts?

17.speaker: Aradin
17.text: You're outta luck. Halsin - druid who runs this place - knew his stuff. But he ain't here anymore.

107.speaker: Aradin
107.text: Think he's got an apprentice running around somewheres though. Nadine? Natalie? Something like that.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I already met her - she says Halsin left the grove with you. Is that true?

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Do you have any idea where Halsin went?

130.speaker: Player
130.text: What are you doing round these parts?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: And whose home is this exactly?

64.speaker: Aradin
64.text: Druids. And they ain't the friendly type. The only one of 'em worth a damn was the leader, and he ain't here anymore.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Do you have any idea where he is?

111.speaker: Player
111.text: What makes you say they're not friendly?

66.speaker: Aradin
66.text: They like trees more than they like people.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: You got along with their leader, though?

52.speaker: Player
52.text: You got along with their leader?

74.speaker: Aradin
74.text: Better than the others, but not well enough to risk my neck for him.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Devils? Seriously? They're tieflings. Same as me.

119.speaker: Aradin
119.text: What? You lot come from devils, don't you?

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Bet I could find something nasty in your family tree, too.

4.speaker: Aradin
4.text: Fair enough. I ain't tryin' to start the shite with you, anyway. Been a day.

135.speaker: Aradin
135.text: First, I lost half my crew in some godforsaken temple.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Yes - it's where I got my good looks. Did you come from a gelatinous ooze?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I'm not local either - got a problem with that?

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm more concerned about the First Druid - heard he left the grove with you?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You might be, if you demonstrated more honour in your dealings.

45.speaker: Aradin
45.text: Please. A good sword will get you farther than honour any day.
